Problem:
Consider a complex function mapping operation where \\( z(t) = u(t) + iv(t) \\) evolves over time under the transformation \\( h(z) = e^{i\\omega t} z \\), with \\( \\omega \\) being a constant real number and \\( i \\) representing the imaginary unit.

If \\( h(z) \\) is applied to a complex number \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0, and \\( z(t) \\) then evolves under the rule \\( \\dot{z} = cz \\) for some constant complex number c without further intervention, will the value of \\( z(T) \\) at t = T be equivalent to the evolution of \\( z_0 \\) directly under \\( \\dot{z} = cz \\) for the same period?
Explanation: The initial transformation \\( h(z) = e^{i\\omega t} z \\) rotates \\( z_0 \\) in the complex plane, altering its path distinctly from merely evolving under \\( \\dot{z} = cz \\). This affects the trajectory and ultimately the position of \\( z(T) \\).
